*div1 type="summary"* *p*[May 18, 1830.] Memorandum by Austin on the law of April 6, 1830.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*San Felipe de Austin*/location_mentioned* *date_mentioned n="05-xx-1830">May 1830*/date_mentioned**/p* *p*Recd, the law of *date_mentioned n="04/06/1830">6 April*/date_mentioned* the 11 Article of which suspends contracts for colonization in which*person_mentioned* North Americans*/person_mentioned* were to be introduced and prohibited the emigration of *person_mentioned*North Americans*/person_mentioned* to this *location_mentioned*country*/location_mentioned*.*/p*
*p*Considering this unjust interference with the rights vested in me by my contracts on colonization. I wrote to the *person_mentioned*President Bustamante*/person_mentioned* and to *person_mentioned*Genl Teran*/person_mentioned* on the*date_mentioned n="05/18/1830"> 18 May */date_mentioned*(See copies of said two letters)—in *date_mentioned n="06-xx-1830">June */date_mentioned*I recd *person_mentioned*Genl Teran*/person_mentioned*s explanation of the law of *date_mentioned n="04-06-1830">6 April*/date_mentioned* by which I was informed that it did not in any manner interfere with my *location_mentioned*colony*/location_mentioned*—in consequence of this explanation I wrote to *person_mentioned*Genl Teran*/person_mentioned* and to the *person_mentioned*Vice President*/person_mentioned* explaining away the harsh parts of my letter of *date_mentioned n="05/18/1830">18 May*/date_mentioned**/p*.
*p*During the months of *date_mentioned n="05-xx-1830">May*/date_mentioned*, *date_mentioned n="06-xx-1830">June */date_mentioned*and *date_mentioned n="07-xx-1830">July */date_mentioned*considerable and alarming excitement prevailed amongst the *person_mentioned*people of *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned**/person_mentioned* and on the *location_mentioned*Nacogdoches frontier*/location_mentioned* it was so violent as [to] be on the eve of breaking out.*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Padilla*/person_mentioned*s confinement put a stop to the land business and this was thought to be a part of the plan to break up the new *person_mentioned*settlers */person_mentioned*in *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned*, resolutions of an inflamatory nature were entered into on the *location_mentioned*Ayish Bayou */location_mentioned*etc. *person_mentioned*J. J. C.*/person_mentioned* (?) came to see me— I advised peace and quietness he coinsided with me— I was of opinion that a popular commotion amongst the people would totally ruin the whole *location_mentioned*country */location_mentioned*and destroy those who had anything to loose and as it was my duty to try [to] avert so great an evil from my *location_mentioned*colony*/location_mentioned*, I resorted to such measures as I could to offset the object and accordingly caused *person_mentioned*Bustamante*/person_mentioned*s letter to me of *date_mentioned n="03/20/1830">20 March*/date_mentioned* to be published in the *location_mentioned*Texas Gazette*/location_mentioned* also *person_mentioned*Teran*/person_mentioned*'s official letter, and on the *date_mentioned n="07-10-1830">10 July*/date_mentioned* some general remarks which were intended to allay public excitement by giving an explanation of the causes which had produced the law of *date_mentioned n="04-06-1830">6 April */date_mentioned*and to shew that those causes were fast disappearing—- I never believed that this *person_mentioned*Govt*/person_mentioned*, intended to oppress us or treat us unjustly in any manner for we had never [given] them any cause to do so and if such was the intention it would be placing us on higher ground to do our duty faithfully as*person_mentioned* Mexican citizens*/person_mentioned*.*/p*
*p*[Indorsed:] *date_mentioned n="05-xx-1830">May 1830*/date_mentioned* [but evidently written later than July] Memorandum*person_mentioned* S. F. Austin*/person_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
